mainTopic.title: Accessory digestive organs
mainTopic.content_info: The content includes both anatomical and physiological information, however in each subtopic we only need the anatomical information to be turned into revision questions

quizzes.question: What are the anatomical locations of the major salivary glands in the human body?
quizzes.goodAnswer: The parotid glands are located near the ears, the submandibular glands are situated on the floor of the mouth, and the sublingual glands are found under the tongue.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: The parotid glands are below the tongue, submandibular glands are near the ears, and sublingual glands are located in the floor of the mouth.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: All major salivary glands, including parotid, submandibular, and sublingual, are located in the neck region.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: The sublingual and submandibular glands are located near the ears, whereas the parotid glands are found under the tongue.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: The major salivary glands such as the parotid, submandibular, and sublingual are all situated within the oral cavity itself.

quizzes.question: Which salivary gland is the largest and where is it located?
quizzes.goodAnswer: The parotid gland is the largest salivary gland and it is located near the ears, wrapped around the mandibular ramus.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: The largest is the sublingual gland, which is located under the tongue.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: The submandibular gland is the largest and is found in the floor of the mouth.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: The largest salivary gland is the parotid, located in the lower jaw.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: The sublingual gland, positioned directly below the jaw, is the largest among the salivary glands.

quizzes.question: Describe the location and the primary anatomical divisions of the liver.
quizzes.goodAnswer: The liver is situated in the right upper quadrant of the abdomen, protected by the ribcage. It is divided into a large right lobe and a smaller left lobe, which are further subdivided into the caudate and quadrate lobes.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: Located in the left abdomen, the liver consists of two equal-sized lobes, the anterior and posterior.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: The liver is positioned in the lower abdomen and includes several small lobes that function independently.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: It is found in the central abdominal region with multiple small lobes making up its structure.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Situated in the upper left quadrant, the liver is divided into the superior and inferior lobes.

quizzes.question: Where is the pancreas located in relation to the stomach?
quizzes.goodAnswer: The pancreas is located posteriorly to the stomach, extending horizontally across the posterior abdominal wall.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: The pancreas sits laterally to the stomach, spanning the width of the abdominal cavity.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: It is positioned anterior to the stomach attached to the lower section of the esophagus.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: Located below the stomach, the pancreas wraps around the inferior belly.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: The pancreas is directly above the stomach, forming the upper curve of the small intestine.

quizzes.question: Where is the gallbladder located and what is its primary anatomical feature?
quizzes.goodAnswer: The gallbladder is nestled in a shallow area on the posterior aspect of the right lobe of the liver, and is recognized by its fundus, body, and neck.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: Located within the left lobe of the liver, the gallbladder is distinguished by its large neck and small body.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: The gallbladder is positioned at the inferior border of the pancreas, mainly noted for its long cylindrical shape.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: It is attached to the underside of the spleen, featuring a prominent base and a tapered apex.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Found below the liver, the gallbladder's primary feature is its divided internal chamber which aids in bile storage.

quizzes.question: Describe the composition and the primary divisions of the peritoneum.
quizzes.goodAnswer: The peritoneum is a serous membrane consisting of a squamous epithelial layer and connective tissue. It is divided into parietal and visceral layers, enveloping the abdominal organs and lining the abdominal wall.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_1: Composed of muscular and connective tissue, the peritoneum includes anterior and posterior divisions that cover the abdominal organs.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_2: It consists of three layers: mucosal, submucosal, and muscular, covering the internal organs of the abdominal cavity.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_3: The peritoneum is made up of dense fibrous tissue divided into upper and lower sections, providing structural support to abdominal organs.
quizzes.wrongAnswer_4: Featuring an epithelial and muscular layer, the peritoneum encompasses the left and right divisions, protecting abdominal structures.
